plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun's movement. Sunflowers are native to North America and widely cultivated as ornamental plants and for seeds and oil.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism, turning their heads to face the sun during the day to maximize photosynthesis.

plants.name: Lobelia cardinalis
plants.description: A striking perennial wildflower with bright red tubular flowers that attract hummingbirds. It prefers moist soils along streams and wetlands.
plants.funFact: The bright red flowers of the cardinal flower are specifically adapted to attract hummingbirds, which are its primary pollinators.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region, widely cultivated in warm climates. It blooms profusely with clusters of flowers in white, pink, red, or yellow hues.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring through fall, including August
plants.funFact: All parts of the oleander plant are poisonous if ingested, but it remains a popular ornamental plant due to its long blooming period and drought tolerance.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: A spectacular South African native shrub famed for its large, exotic flowers with spiky petals resembling a crown. It is the national flower of South Africa.
plants.funFact: The King Protea flower can grow up to 30 cm (12 inches) in diameter and is a symbol of change and hope.
